page.title: 01CAMPSEA ASHE AND ENVIRONS
page.content: Flat arable, almost hedgeless land of heavy soil predominates. Wheat, barley, sugar beet, rape and peas and beans for commercial freezing are the main crops. Only one dairy herd is left in the area. Deciduous tree planting is taking place to replace stricken elms. The population is sparse except in Campsea Ashe where a few houses are grouped round the shop, the church, and a mainly post-war estate. Work is supplied by the farms and garages locally, but many travel to the nearby Air Base, to offices and shops in local towns, and to service industries (eg. hospitals, electricity, telecom and P.O). There is a weekly cattle, pig, poultry and vegetable market and a monthly antique furniture sale. The main railway line passes through the area. Pay trains stop at Campsea Ashe and provide a
